resources.string: I\'ll explain you how\nto cook your dishes:Find the mascot:Capture it:Click on top to select ingredients:Drag them on chopping board:...and cook!!!
I am very happy. I have just created

the pizza is a delicacy typical of Neapolitan cuisine, today, with the pasta, the best known of Italian gastronomy. with this name, virtually unknown beyond the city walls Neapolitan, even in the nineteenth century, is indicated cakes, almost always sweet. it was not until the early nineteenth century that the pizza assumed, always in Naples, its current connotation, the next global success of the dish, led by extension, to define in the same way any similar preparation.

the Varenyky are a traditional dish of pasta stuffed Ukrainian triangular or half moon, with stuffed potato, meat, cheese or soft berries (cherries, blueberries etc.). this dish is considered one of the most traditional dishes of Ukraine.

pelmeni are a traditional dish of Siberia and central-eastern europe product stuffed with mixed meat, wrapped in a thin sheet (made of flour and eggs, sometimes with the addition of milk or water). pork, lamb, beef, or any other type of meat can be used as a filling; mix up the different types is a common custom

the pavlova is a sweet summer of Australian origin. the base of the pavlova consists of a meringue covered with whipped cream and decorated with fresh fruits, such as berries, strawberries and kiwi. the difficulty in this dessert is to be able to prepare a meringue golden, crispy on the outside and very soft inside but the end result will definitely tasty. pairing with fresh fruit and cream gives the pavlova a special flavor and makes this cake a sweet very good and tasty.

bazeen is one of the most typical dishes of North Africa. it\'s among the most widespread in western Libya, and is often served for lunch on Friday. There are variations of bazeen lamb, containing camel meat, chicken, squid or beans. a variant of winter bazeen is served with a soup hassa made with dried meat.

in Japanese cuisine sushi is a food made of rice along with other ingredients such as fish, algae, plants or eggs. the filling can be raw, cooked or marinated and can be served resting on rice, rolled in a strip of seaweed, placed in rice rolls or inserted into a small pocket of tofu. in Japan the word sushi literally means "acid" and refers to a wide range of foods made with rice. outside of japan is often understood as raw fish, or as a reference to a restricted kind of Japanese foods, such as maki or nigiri and sashimi.

the ajiaco is a thick soup and particularly popular in Colombia. is one of the most beloved national dishes and there are several variables; the best known is the ajiaco bogotano or ajiaco santafereño, which takes its name from Bogotá (ancient name of bogota), the capital of Colombia, where this dish is a cultural tradition

feijoada is one of the typical dishes of Brazilian cuisine, probably the best known and representative. The term comes from feijão that in Portuguese is going to bean, this being one of the typical ingredients.

the burger (also called in Italian Swiss or pressed) is a meatball minced meat and pressed - usually beef but also chicken - cooked mostly on the plate. the term, with the spread of international chain of fast food is passed to identify even a sandwich consisting of bread, minced beef (hamburger, in fact), sauces and condiments.
the pancake, also known by the French term of crepe is a type of wafer thin, soft and supple, cooked on a hot surface round.

the fish and chips is a typical dish of British cuisine. consists of white fish fillet (usually Gadidae such as cod or haddock) fried in batter and surrounded by abundant and thick chips, also fried, choices among cultivars floury maris piper, king edward or Desirée. is served with a sprinkle of salt and vinegar

the preparation of this dish stewed gives rise to a very soft and shredded meat, which lends itself well to the filling of many other local foods such as arepas and empanadas. Today this recipe is prepared thanks to a pressure cooker, which leaves the soft flesh without having to tap it in advance and that allows us to achieve the right degree of doneness.
